thread.title: Oregon Gov.: Now is not the time to talk about gun control
thread.title_full: Oregon Gov.: Now is not the time to talk about gun control

title: Oregon Gov.: Now is not the time to talk about gun control
text:
CNN.com
Donald Trump would 'absolutely' hire Ben Carson Updated 1308 GMT (2008 HKT) October 2, 2015 JUST WATCHED Trump calls Carson a 'nice man' Says the retired doctor isn't a tough negotiator Washington (CNN) If Donald Trump bests Ben Carson to win the White House, the former neurosurgeon may have a special place in Washington regardless -- in the Trump administration. Trump said Friday that he would "absolutely" put Carson in his Cabinet if he were to win the presidency. "I would put him -- I'd love to have that," Trump said on MSNBC's "Morning Joe." Trump called Carson a "nice man" and said so far the two have had a "very good relationship," seemingly ignoring a roughly two-week span in September during which the two traded jabs on faith and energy. The real estate mogul said that while Carson would be "qualified" to win the GOP nomination and presidency, he wouldn't do the job as well as a President Trump. He doubted Carson's abilities as a tough negotiator. "I would say it's not his wheelhouse, but that I don't know," Trump said. However, there's still room for Carson in Trump's Washington. "Certain elements of the administration, I think he'd be very good," he said, ignoring a question about what those roles would be.
More from Politics
